column4: with broadcom wireless chips, why does Ubuntu by default offer the possibility to install the binary-only drivers via "additional drivers", even though the open-source ones are also available and packaged in the repositories?
wifi is one of those places we still have a long way to go on.  Every time we get caught up, some random company goes and changes the API's on us. :P
It also doesn't mean that the OSS version is properly QA'ed. :)  Trust me, companies often like to give us steaming piles of crap when they "go open"
are you involved or do you have insight into the Wifi development?
